ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Of late, rural development has assumed global attention especially among the developing nations. It has great significance for a country like India where majority of the population, around 65% of the people, live in rural areas. The present strategy of rural development in India mainly focuses on poverty alleviation, better livelihood opportunities, provision of basic amenities and infrastructure facilities through innovative programmes of wage and self-employment. This article overviews the role and function of the Government and itsâ€™ programmes for rural development in India. Science and technological interventions in the field of rural development have been discussed briefly and efforts being made to document some of the appropriate technologies developed by several research institutes, organizations suitable for application in rural areas are listed. Besides, the actual realization achieved during the Xth plan and the proposed target and strategy of the XIth plan have been highlighted to showcase the recent trend of developmental activities under the Ministry of Rural Development.

ngoList.title: SOCIETY FOR INDIAN ACADEMY OF MEDICAL GENETICS
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Indian Academy of Medical Genetics (IAMG) is a professional organization established by qualified medical geneticists from all over India. It is run by the Society for Indian Academy of Medical Genetics, registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860, at Lucknow, specifically formed for this purpose in January 2012. The main objectives of the organization are to improve the quality and accessibility of clinical genetics services in the country, to promote medical genetics education and research, to help integrate medical genetics research into patient care, and thereby to promote the overall advancement of this medical discipline in India. The IAMG serves as a forum of interaction for medical genetics centres across the country to enable coordinated patient care, research and teaching in the field of medical genetics. This expert group is also meant to act as an advisory body to the government and the society in matters pertaining to medical genetics.

The society took up the S. H. Gs. Works with women with the linkages with bank in Allahabad district the under NBARD, under sponsorship development program sponsored by NBARD for empowerment of women and trodden section of villages community. We have done in the field of Horticulture, Organized Training and exposer in visit of progressive farmers from Allahabad to Hisar (Haryana), with visits many Horticulture Agriculture University and Institutions on the way with founded by National Horticulture Board, Haryana. For the awareness and Action creation in environmental protection and pollution control last 15 years, global warming and many items of development done to gather with. We have conducted Air Pollution, Water Pollution, Noise Pollution monitoring is partnership of with Central pollution Control Board New Delhi and also organized workshops on these issues. Over all these above, we have been conducting monitoring N. E. A. C. program under Ministry of Environment and Forests, Government of India, for last 15 years or so with good credit. We are doing much and legal awareness programs to words on the women empowerment such as legal advices on family matter and the like. We have been fortunate enough to be provided with ample space and facilities by Maha Kumbh Mela Authority for propagating and launching our integrated development of programs and over fifty thousand visitors are benefited 2001 organized camp and performed over program. With benefit to thousand visitors likewise in the present Maha Kumbh Mela 2012-13 we organized our camp and performed our activities by these visitors Indian and foreigner both were benefited.

ngoList.title: SOCIETY OF BIOLOGICAL SCIENCES AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT

isuues.name: Key Issues
isuues.value: Agriculture,Biotechnology,Environment & Forests,Rural Development & Poverty Alleviation,Science & Technology

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Society of Biological Sciences and Rural Development was established on 19th October, 2004 by the initiative and personal efforts as well of Dr. Gopal Pandey besides some of the members of different fields from agriculture, life sciences and rural development. Society of Biological Sciences and Rural Development is registered under the Society Registration Act, 1860 (la[;k 3011 i=koyh la&1@Al-18830). The society is also registered under IT act 12A No. 58-59/52/12AA & 80G(5)(vii) 2010-2011/5901 and 4/580G No. 58-59/16/12AA & 80G 5 (vi) 2010-2011/5900 of 31.12.2010-11/5900 of 31.12.2010. The society is publishing one Journal and one Hindi Patrika, both has RNI and ISSN No. The society also published ten books with ISBN No. The ultimate objective of the Society is economic improvement through the transfer of scientific technologies in rural areas. The Society would like to fulfill its mission through publication of research journals-original research papers, review articles, popular articles, news bulletins and extension pamphlets in the above chosen field as well as organizing seminars/ symposia/kisan gosthies on the relevant topics. It is also envisaged to invite eminent scientists to deliver talks on various aspects for dessimation of technologies on ground levels. The National Academy of Biological Sciences and Rural Development, a research wing of Society of Biological Sciences and Rural Development, has got national repute for conducting agricultural and biological researches poses enormous scope for multidisciplinary interactions for solving fundamental problems of applied research. There are 500 members associated with scientific journals published by Society of Biological Sciences and Rural Development, Allahabad. Hence it is easy to get relevant material as well as to conduct multi-location trials. The centre has requisite infrastructural facilities for conducting research successfully. Five scientists are working in this centre in different field like Plant pathology, Nematology and Fisheries. Department of Science and Technology Govt. of Indian New Delhi financed two projects (Project No. SSD/SS/027/2008) and SEED/DISHA/WOS-B/019/2012) to society and one project has been successfully completed dated 23rd Jan. 2013 and other project (Project No. SEED/DISHA/WOSB/ 019/2012) has been successfully completed dated 12.03.2014. Some Projects has also been submitted in different agency like D.S.T., D.B.T. and I.C.A.R., New Delhi for financial support. Society organized Two symposium and one National workshop viz. National Symposium on prospects, utility and challenges of biotechnology in Agricultural development during 11-12, November 2011 in Allahabad, (U.P.) and National Symposium on Innovative and modern technologies for Sustainable agriculture and rural development during 19-20, October, 2013 in Allahabad (U.P.) and one workshop viz. Technological Innovation in Agriculture and Rural Development during 13, December, 2015-20 December, 2016. Five Hundred professors, Principal Scientists, Scientists, Students participated in the symposium, Sixteen lead talks were delivered and 250 research and poster papers were presented in sixteen technical seniors of symposium and 150 participants were participated in one week national workshop.

ngoList.title: Sonchirayia Loak Sangeet Utthan Samiti
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Son Chirayia is a non profit apolitical organization to propagate and preserve the folk art forms of India under the able guidance of Padmabhushan Vidushi Girija Devi ji and renowned folk singer and artist Smt Malini Awasthi. We are four years old organization and have conducted grand shows showcasing the traditional folk art forms from Awadh, Bhojpur, Banaras, Bundelkhand, Braj etc. We at Son Chirayia believe that folk music of most part of India has untapped potential which is yet to get proper exposure in the national capital. Folk art forms of India represent the social and cultural fabric of India in its original color and has numerous outstanding folk artists who need to be given proper stage and exposure. Son Chirayia has been promoting several folk art forms like â€˜Birhaâ€™, â€˜Alhaâ€™, â€˜Dhobiaâ€™, â€˜Raaiâ€™, â€˜Pai-dandaâ€™, â€˜Hardaulâ€™, â€˜Rasiyaâ€™, â€˜Charkulaâ€™, â€˜Kajariâ€™, â€˜Faguaâ€™, â€˜Nautankiâ€™, â€˜Karmaâ€™, â€˜Nirgunâ€™, and traditional wedding songs.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The project was AZADI KE LOK RANG to celebrate independence through folk music and dance in four cities of Uttar Pradesh i.e. Kanpur (26th February 2017), Meerut (10th May 2017), Gorakhpur (14th May 2017) and Mahoba (23rd July 2017).
POORAB RANG was organized in New Delhi to commemorate the Birth Centenary Year of Bharat Ratna Ustad Bismillah Khan from 15th to 18th March 2017. It was a music and dance festival.
